result.execSummary:
The defendant David Hamilton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. David Hamilton is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • David Hamilton was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Concurrent to  case 14CF3562.  If defendant qualifies for college scholarship in another State, can provide proof of enrollement, and transfer is appoved by probation department, Court will authoirze transfer of probation to another State.

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Anger management and cognitive intervention programming.
Follow through with any terms and conditions deemed appropriate by the probation department.
AODA assessment. Follow through with any recommended programming.
Pay all applicable court costs and surcharges, DNA surcharge.  All to be paid during period of probation. Any unpaid amount to be converted to a civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David Hamilton

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Bail Refund Check Packet

Defendant David Hamilton in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Hanna Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Statements made as to sentencing.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Corrections CONCURRENT to case #14CF3562, with credit for 9 days time served.  
The Court STAYED this sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 1 YEAR CONCURRENT to case #14CF3562 with the following conditions:  
*AODA assessment and follow through with recommended programming; 
*Anger management and cognitive intervention programming;
*Work or attend school
*No weapons
*No new offenses
*Follow through with any terms and conditions deemed appropriate by the probation department
If defendant qualifies for college scholarship in another State, can provide proof of enrollment, and transfer is approved by probation department, Court will authorize transfer of probation to another State. 
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges.
All costs and surcharges to be paid during the period of probation. Any unpaid amount to be converted to a civil judgment.

Filed, Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
Justice Point Pretrial Report, filed.

Attorney Michael Jude in court.  Antonella Aleman for Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter is in Court on defense request for defendant to be placed back on Justice Point monitoring. Court orders that defendant be reinstated to Justice Point monitoring, all previous terms and conditions to apply. Matter remains scheduled for sentencing on 10/16/15 at 8:30am in Br. 35.
Justice Point Pretrial Report, filed.

Defendant David Hamilton in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs for Michael Jude.  Denis John Stingl for Hanna Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jude is not available today due to family emergency. Defense is requesting adjourned date. Court admonishes defendant re: recent Justice Point report. Court grants adjournment request.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Report, filed.
Justice Point Violation Report, filed. Court takes no action.
Defendant David Hamilton in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Denis Stingl for Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter is scheduled for sentencing today, Court is in trial.
Justice Point Pretrial Report, filed.

Defendant David Hamilton in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 1. On motion of the State, Court orders Use of a Dangerous Weapon enhancer AND COUNT 2 DISMISSED. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court hears statements as to sentencing. Court holds brief conference with counsel in chambers off the record. For reasons as stated on the record, Court orders sentencing hearing adjourned. Attorney Jude to provide additional information to the Court at sentencing as requested.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial report, filed.

Defendant David Hamilton in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 7.   All parties notified as of August 03, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35, in room 629 of the courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-06-2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.
Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant David Hamilton not in court, in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for return on warrant. Arguments heard as to bail. Court does not increase bail at this time. All conditions of bail remain the same.  Case remains scheduled for plea and sentencing on 07/24/2015 at 11:00am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Attorney Michael Jude in court.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE.  Present in court is Justice Point Case Worker JAZYMNN MCCAIN.  Case in court due to violation.  Defendant left before violation was addressed.  Defendant is to pay $25 to challenge test results.  Arguments heard as to bail.

Defendant David Hamilton in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 7.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-24-2015 at 11:00 am.

Case adjourned for scheduling.
Milwaukee County Pretrial Services Violation Report, received and filed.  Court takes no action.

Defendant David Hamilton in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference.  Scheduling conference scheduled for 06-18-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant David Hamilton in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Deann Heard for Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams, Branch 07.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

NO COURT FILE. Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.

Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant David Hamilton in court with attorney Joan E. Zawikowski.  
Defendant David Hamilton in custody.  
Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
